typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.lti.deiis.qa.types.QAAnnotation
typeDescription.description: QAAnnotator is the base annotation for this system. It extends UIMAâ€™s built-in Annotation class with additional fields, namely casProcessorID and confidence.

featureDescription.name: confidence
featureDescription.description: the assigned confidence for this QAAnnotation

featureDescription.name: casProcessorID
featureDescription.description: the Annotator/Processor that produced this Annotation.

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.lti.deiis.qa.types.Answer
typeDescription.description: Annotation used to distinguish an Answer statement.

featureDescription.name: isCorrect
featureDescription.description: boolean flag for trained data that signifies whether this answer is correct (true) or incorrect (false).

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.lti.deiis.qa.types.AnswerScore
typeDescription.description: score given by a scoring mechanism for a specific question-answer pair.

featureDescription.name: answer
featureDescription.description: Answer that this answer score belongs to.

featureDescription.name: question
featureDescription.description: Question for which this answer score pertains to.

featureDescription.name: score
featureDescription.description: the score value (between 0 and 1) for a question and answer pair.

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.lti.deiis.qa.types.Question
typeDescription.description: Annotation used to distinguish a Question statement.

featureDescription.name: candidateAnswers
featureDescription.description: a list of candidate Answers for this statement

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.lti.deiis.qa.types.NGram
typeDescription.description: N-grams are N-consecutive token combinations contained within statements.

featureDescription.name: tokens
featureDescription.description: Tokens contained within an NGram object

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.lti.deiis.qa.types.Token
typeDescription.description: Annotation for the single token of a statement.

typeDescription.name: edu.cmu.lti.deiis.qa.types.StatementBase
typeDescription.description: StatementBase is the annotation used to describe a line of text. StatementBase objects contain a finite number of tokens and n-grams.

featureDescription.name: tokens
featureDescription.description: a list of Token annotations for this statement

featureDescription.name: unigrams
featureDescription.description: a list of unigram annotations for this sentence.

featureDescription.name: bigrams
featureDescription.description: a list of bigram annotations for this sentence.

featureDescription.name: trigrams
featureDescription.description: a list of trigram annotations for this statement.
